intro: Myrcia ypanemensis, commonly known as the Ypanemense Myrtle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Brazil, specifically the state of Pará, and is found in moist, tropical rainforest environments. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically consumed by various bird species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
